Hi all,

I'm happy to announce our new game Evolve, made by Daniel Jallov, =
a master
student at ITU supervised by myself and Julian Togelius.

The game=
 consists of two major parts: an evolution part where neural
networks are e=
volved using NEAT, and a battle part where players use the
evolved networks=
 to control their robots. The goal of the project is to
investigate whether=
 giving the player indirect control over the robot (by
switching brains in =
battle) is an engaging game mechanic and whether it
makes sense to put the =
AI in the hands of the player.

Check it out here: http://jallov.com/thesis=
/

Looking forward to your comments!

Cheers,
Sebastian

From the webpage:
=

"Evolve is a game about becoming the greatest robot trainer of all time.
Y=
our mission is to teach a simple robot how to fight and ultimately take it
=
to the Champion=E2=80=99s arena to battle against other trainers. To reach =
this
goal, you must teach your robot how to move and how to fight, and you =
must
have the tactical nouse to tell your robot what to do in the heat of
b=
attle. Your robot will gradually become more advanced as you progress
throu=
gh the missions, and when the missions are completed you will be ready
to b=
attle online against other players."


--
Dr. Sebastian Risi
Assistant Prof=
essor
IT University of Copenhagen, Room 5D08
Rued Langgaards Vej 7, 2300 Co=
penhagen, Denmark
email: sebastian.risi@..., web: www.sebastianrisi.c=
om
